meanings.definition: Not prepared or equipped for a particular situation.
meanings.sent1: The student was unready for the surprise test.
meanings.sent2: She felt unready to face the challenges ahead.
meanings.sent3: The unready chef tried to cook a gourmet meal with no recipe.
meanings.sent4: His unready mind was like a ship without a compass.
meanings.sent5: The unready soldier stood frozen in fear on the battlefield.

meanings.definition: Lacking the necessary skill or knowledge.
meanings.sent1: The unready swimmer struggled in the deep end of the pool.
meanings.sent2: He was unready to tackle the complex math problem.
meanings.sent3: The unready driver attempted to parallel park but failed miserably.
meanings.sent4: Her unready hands fumbled with the intricate puzzle pieces.
meanings.sent5: The unready student couldn't answer any of the exam questions.

meanings.sent1: The unready team forgot their equipment for the game.
meanings.sent2: The unready traveler missed the train by a minute.
meanings.sent3: His unready speech was filled with awkward pauses and stutters.
meanings.sent4: The unready plan fell apart at the first sign of trouble.
meanings.sent5: The unready hiker found himself lost in the wilderness without a map.
